arm_group.description: Non-Caucasian male and female adult subjects (greater than or equal to 18 years of age) with an initial diagnosis of suspected PD or ET who underwent DaTscan SPECT imaging to assist with the subject's final clinical diagnosis of PD or ET.

Caucasian male and female adult subjects (greater than or equal to 18 years of age) with an initial diagnosis of suspected PD or ET who underwent DaTscan SPECT imaging to assist with the subject's final clinical diagnosis of PD or ET.

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary objective of this study is to determine if the diagnostic performance of
      DaTscan™ single photon emission computed tomography (SPECT) imaging is different in
      non-Caucasian subjects compared with Caucasian subjects with movement disorders.

clinical_study.brief_title: Compare Rates of Agreement Between Clinical Diagnosis and Visual Assessment of DaTscan™ Images in Non-Caucasian and Caucasian Subjects With Parkinson's Disease (PD) or Essential Tremor (ET)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        For Non-Caucasians:

          -  Non-Caucasian male and female adult subjects (greater than or equal to 18 years of
             age) with an initial diagnosis of suspected PD or ET who underwent DaTscan SPECT
             imaging to assist with the subject's final clinical diagnosis of PD or ET.

          -  The subject has existing diagnostic-quality and interpretable DaTscan SPECT images of
             the brain.

        For Caucasians:

          -  Caucasian male and female adult subjects (greater than or equal to 18 years of age)
             with an initial diagnosis of suspected PD or ET who underwent DaTscan SPECT imaging
             to assist with the subject's final clinical diagnosis of PD or ET.

          -  The subject has existing diagnostic-quality and interpretable DaTscan SPECT images of
             the brain.

          -  The subject is matched by final clinical diagnosis, sex and age (±5 years)  with a
             non-Caucasian subject.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Known/suspected structural abnormalities of the brain (e.g., hydrocephalus; brain
             tumor; stroke; etc.) that can grossly distort the DaTscan images.

study_pop.textblock:
Non-Caucasian and Caucasian Subjects With Parkinson's Disease (PD) or Essential Tremor
        (ET).

intervention.description: The subjects in this study were dosed with DaTscan drug product in a separate study.
intervention.intervention_name: Subjects dosed in a separate study

clinical_study.official_title: A Retrospective Clinical Study to Compare the Rates of Agreement Between Clinical Diagnosis and Visual Assessment of DaTscan™ Images in Non-Caucasian and Caucasian Subjects With Parkinson's Disease (PD) or Essential Tremor (ET)

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: Blinded visual assessment of each subject's DaTscan™  image as normal or abnormal by majority interpretation in the Blinded Image Evaluation (BIE).
primary_outcome.measure: Blinded visual assessment of each subject's DaTscan image as normal or abnormal

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Abnormal images will be further categorized as 1) abnormal and typical of PD, or 2) abnormal but atypical of PD.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Retrospective
